text:
Cloud technologies offer many
tools and resources that drive

cost down in a holistic
manner.

These resources can help your
business to compete globally

and on a much more level playing
field with businesses

that are orders of magnitude
bigger than you.

Instead of investing in expensive
hardware, you can leverage

cloud services that offer virtualized
resources on a pay-as-you-go
model.

This shift from capital expenditure
(CapEx) to operational

expenditure (OpEx) allows
you to only pay for the resources

you consume, freeing up capital
for innovative investments.

Furthermore, cloud technologies
help businesses streamline

and automate processes,
leading to increased operational
efficiency and reduced costs.

Cloud-based automation
tools can handle routine

tasks, such as data acquisition,
processing, protection,

backup & recovery, and overall
system monitoring, without

the need for constant human
intervention.

This not only accelerates
processes and increases

business resiliency,
but also minimizes the likelihood

of errors, reducing operational
inefficiencies and the associated
costs.

Brett Promisel, the Chief Operating
Officer of Deep Pool Financial

Solutions observes: “The options
are seemingly infinite in terms

of what we can do using AWS,
and I know we’re just starting

down that path.” Scalability
is another hallmark of cloud

technologies that contributes
to cost reduction.

You don't have to invest in excessive
resources upfront to accommodate

peak loads, avoiding unnecessary
costs while ensuring seamless

performance during spikes
in demand.

Additionally, cloud technologies
facilitate secure remote work

and collaboration,
reducing the need for physical
infrastructure.

At the same time, you can access
the best applications

to run your business via Software
as a Service (SaaS).

This can lead to cost savings
associated with office space,

utilities, and commuting
allowances.

It also helps businesses
to retain talent and tap into

a global talent pool without
geographical limitations.

Here is what David Bartlett,
general manager from the LOTE

Agency said: “Migrating
to AWS has potentially

saved our company hundreds
of thousands of dollars because

we now have the ability to flick
a switch and enable our employees

to work remotely.” Using cloud
technologies can help you innovate

faster and achieve greater
financial efficiency without
compromising on quality or performance.

I would like to invite you to
explore the resources available

on the AWS Connected Community
and find the best path for your
business.

To help you in your cloud journey,
AWS has also developed

a vibrant and diverse network
of over 100,000 partners
from more than 150 countries.

This network provides you with
local, industry, and use case
expertise.

For more information
on SMB related topics, check
out the links in the description.
Thanks for watching!
